page.title: 08LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: WE WERE COUNTING THE BUILDINGS IN THE FRINTON-ON-SEA AREA,INSIDE THE GATES. THE DIFFERENT BUILDINGS THAT WE HAD TO COUNT WERE, PUBLIC HOUSES, CHURCHES, CLUB HOUSES, SCHOOLS, INDUSTRY, PUBLIC BUILDINGS & OTHERS. IN THE WHOLE OF FRINTON THERE WERE NO PUBLIC HOUSES, FIVE CHURCHES, THREE CLUB HOUSES, TWO SCHOOLS, THIRTY INDUSTRYS, EIGHT PUBLIC BUILDINGS AND THIRTY EIGHT OTHERS. A WIDE VARIETY OF BUILDING MATERIAL HAS BEEN USED. THE CHURCH IN GREAT HOLLAND IS MADE FROM FLINT AND BRICK. THE PARISH CHURCH IN FRINTON IS CONSTRUCTED IN BRICK. THE FREE CHURCH IS CONSTRUCTEDIN MODERN BUILDING MATERIAL. NEW HOUSING JUST OUTSIDE THE GATES AT FRINTON IS CONSTRUCTED 'TRADITIONALLY'i.e.USING BRICK AND BREEZE BLOCK. SOME NEW HOUSING HOWEVER HAS THE NEW TIMBER FRAMING.
